Posts.Content: Mar 31, 2007 08:10AM Angielynn wrote: Thanks so much for being there. You're so right about the negative posts. It's just that I feel I'm being given one statistic but seeing a different statistic on the web. I would really like to know what's the reality in this case. Thanks again for posting your good results!
Posts.Title: Microcalcification with one small linear branch Angielynn Angielynn

Posts.Content: Angielynn wrote: I've been told I have a microcalcification with one tiny linear branch. I've been told that 80% of microcalcifications are benign, but I keep reading about linear branches being much more frequently cancer. Does anyone know the real percentage with this type of formation? I've seen some conflicting stuff on the web and I just want to know the truth. Thanks! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Microcalcification with one small linear branch Angielynn Angielynn
